title: Israel, Hamas Agree on Ceasefire and Prisoner Exchange in Gaza Peace Effort
snippets: A government spokesperson has laid out how Israel will implement the first phase of the peace plan for Gaza.
Trump announced that Israel and Hamas had agreed on the first phase of a peace plan which could put an end to the two-year war and free hostages.
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu won cabinet approval for the first phase of a cease-fire agreement with Hamas. President Trump said hostages held in Gaza would be released early next week.

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said he would convene his government on Thursday to sign off on the agreement. Hamas said that the agreement would lead to the end of the war, but many of the details were unclear.
titles: Israel announces timeline for implementing first phase of peace plan

summary: Israel and Hamas have agreed on the first phase of a peace plan, aimed at ending the two-year conflict in Gaza. This initial phase involves a ceasefire and the exchange of hostages for Palestinian prisoners. Despite concerns over unmet demands, both parties see this as a significant step toward peace. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu plans to convene his government to approve the agreement, while Hamas views it as a potential end to the war, although many details remain unclear.
